e4: Although some investors might initially misinterpret earnings changes due to their ingrained habit of adjusting for the bias, transparency is crucial in the long run. Maintaining an unbiased reporting policy builds trust and credibility with all stakeholders, even if it results in short-term market fluctuations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy. It avoids intentional manipulation or obfuscation of financial data, even if such practices are common in an industry.  Full disclosure of methodologies and potential limitations in accounting methods is crucial. The company should aim to provide investors with clear and unbiased insights into its financial performance, enabling them to make informed decisions based on accurate information.
e6: Yes, I would have follow-up questions for the management team.  Specifically, I would like to understand their strategy for communicating the policy change to investors in a clear and transparent manner.  I'd also want to explore contingency plans for mitigating potential short-term market volatility and ensuring that smaller retail investors are not unfairly disadvantaged during the transition.
